summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing the drafting and approval process for a press release from the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It reveals internal coordination and edits between the Bureau of Prisons and the Department of Justice, including a specific edit to describe his offenses and to state the FBI investigated the case, despite previous FBI objections.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the press release being drafted by the Bureau of Prisons, which concerns his death while in custody.

events.title: Drafting of Epstein Death Press Release
events.description: Internal email correspondence reveals the Bureau of Prisons Public Information Office is working with the Department of Justice to finalize a press release about Jeffrey Epstein's death, with edits being made to the description of his offenses and to include that the case was investigated by the FBI.

keyFacts: The document is an email from August 10, 2019, concerning the drafting of a press release about Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The press release was being prepared by the Federal Bureau of Prisons Public Information Office and required approval from the Department of Justice.

Edits to the draft included a change to the description of Epstein's offenses and the insertion of text stating the case was 'investigated by FBI', despite the FBI having previously advised against such a statement.
The document indicates internal coordination and potential disagreement between agencies (BOP, DOJ, FBI) over the messaging surrounding Epstein's death.
The attached files suggest the press release was intended for widespread media distribution, with over 50 media inquiries noted.
